results.content: Good course, I could have marked it down for being outdated with the Google Api App setup bit, however that is not Patricks fault and I figured it out in the end. See QA. Thanks again Patrick for a brilliant course.

response.content: Thank you for your review, Simon. I checked the API setup following your question in the Q&A and everything seems to be the same. I could not replicate the error you mentioned.  I am glad you enjoyed the course.

results.content:
Other than issues setting up the Google credentials this has been a true insight into working with an API.
I have dropped 1/2 star because I cannot get the last piece of code in the "Final Touches" lecture to work.

I have now completed all 3 of Patricks "PHP for Beiginners 20xx" courses and I have been very surprised at how my knowledge has improved.
Patrick has a "golden" way of teaching, is very thorough with each of the lessons, making it easy to understand what is happening.

All I want now is for him to produce a PHP OOP course and I will be signing up to that.

Thank you.

Edit:
I have changed my review and given 5 stars as Patrick has always returned any messages and questions asked.

response.content: Thank you for your review, Andre

results.content: Good course, generally speaking. Not sure however whether the course is really up to date for 2020. I was not able to use all the suggested lines (such as $openAuth = new Google_Service_Oauth2($googleClient); $userData = $openAuth->userinfo_v2_me->get();) and had to dig for alternatives at Stack Overflow (such as, $user_data = $googleClient->verifyIdToken();). Google also seems to have changed some SSL certification requirements. Have to search the Internet for some updated answers. Not for complete beginners but very helpful. And I eventually ended up learning how to build an Google Login for my site just in a day.

response.content: Thank you for your review. Unsure why you experienced that issue as I still use the logins as is on websites.  I'll run through the course again (it is checked regularly) and update anything that needs to be updated.  It sounds like you may have used a different version of the login script.

results.content: Very nice to learn how the "Google Login" works! This course taught me how to set up the system, using Google API's, which I really wanted to learn more! The course was short, but it was a lot of information to absorb for me! Great to know what every line and code meant... really appreciate it!

response.content: Glad you enjoyed the course. Kind regards. Patrick
response.content_html: Glad you enjoyed the course. Kind regards. Patrick

results.content: Learning to work with the Google API was a lot of fun. There was one confusing part I had to debug in terms of the addScope, but I was able to somewhat figure out on my own (I loath not being able to figure out something and like to try to fix it by myself until it is resolved). With a lot of websites offering log in capabilities with google, it's also a useful skill to bring somewhere to the future. I definitely like the instructor's approach to teaching and look forward to delving into any of their future php courses past this one, if they pursue it.

response.content: Thank you for your review, Steven. You will now be able to create your own Google login. Kind regards. Patrick
